results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.

results.title: Conversations with a dead poet: Alan Wearne recalls John Forbes [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Seedwillow, John Izzard and Geoff Burton
results.brief_description: Alan Wearne, poet and tutor hosts this documentary about his friend and colleague John Forbes (1950-98), one of Australia’s most prominent modern poets with his distinctly gritty writing about urban Melbourne and Sydney. Drawing on extracts from several of Forbes’ poems, and discussions with friends and devotees of his writing, the following works are explored in detail: “Tropical skiing”; “On the beach”; “Stalin’s holidays”; “The Stunned mullet”; “Damaged glamour”.
results.title_for_label: Conversations with a dead poet: Alan Wearne recalls John Forbes [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Seedwillow, John Izzard and Geoff Burton

Drawing on extracts from several of Forbes’ poems, and discussions with friends and devotees of his writing, the following works are explored in detail: “Tropical skiing”; “On the beach”; “Stalin’s holidays”; “The Stunned mullet”; “Damaged glamour”.

results.title: Conversation in the garden
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Richard Mudford
results.brief_description: A couple are seen in a suburban garden; outwardly they appear polite, inwardly their thoughts vividly snake through the undergrowth. Cast includes Heather Bolton and Stephen Clements.

results.title: Conversation
results.creator_credit: Centron Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
Demonstrates and explains how conversation (informal speech) reaches into every phase of our everyday life; that is our surest way of making or losing friends, of being hired or fired. Through dramatic incidents, the film illustrates some important do’s and don’ts in social and business conversation, and indicates effective speech techniques to use.

results.title: Convention of Yanmar Overseas Agents, 1964
results.brief_description:
Convention held in Japan for overseas agents of the company Yanmar, founded by Magokichi Yamaoka. Shows the delegates involved in various activities including a visit to the factory, a bus trip to a memorial for the founder, group conference and discussion, social evening event, presentation of awards, a golf day, and the final gathering before departure.
Silent film - no credits available.

results.title: Controversy over the moon
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description: Presents the controversy concerning the geological make-up of the moon - specifically the origin of large lunar craters. Two eminent scientists interpret the same available data and discuss reasons for their divergent views. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Controversy over industrial pollution: a case study
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Luther Gerlach and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in Crisis”.
Anaconda Aluminium Company opened a plant at Columbia Falls, Montana. In 1968, after a plant explosion, poisonous fluoride emissions began to damage trees for miles around. All sides of the resulting controversy are presented objectively in this film,which should spark discussion of the environmental crisis in general and of the scientific, social and economic issues involved in finding solutions to pollution problems

results.title: Controlling stocks
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Management Techniques”.
One of a series of films about some of the problems of forecasting, and of trying to achieve control through forecasts, particularly in the case of small and medium-sized firms. Carrying excessive stocks can be expensive, whilst insufficient stocks may cause loss of customer confidence. Shows how to strike a reasonable balance of stock holdings.

results.title: Controlling quality is everybody's business
results.creator_credit: Industrial Education Films and Wallace J. Richardson
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for a sound working knowledge of the principles of effective quality control, and how these may be applied. The film also dramatises the importance of maintaining good quality, and shows how everyone can help.

results.title: Controlling exposure
results.creator_credit: Coast Community Colleges, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.), CBS, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Sandra Ostertag
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Designed to help students become more aware of the qualities and effects of available light. Jack Welpott shows various indoor and outdoor settings and describes the way he responds to specific lighting conditions. Explores the emotional and aesthetic effects of light together with the technical aspects.
